content: Compose a rap that includes the given line "Don't give up, there's hope" and at least two metaphors related to perseverance, as well as a reference to the current global pandemic and its impact on mental health. Additionally, include at least one verse in which the rhyme scheme follows the pattern of ABABCC.

(Verse 1)
Yo, life’s a mountain, gotta climb that slope,  
In the stormy sea, we sail, we cope.  
Like a phoenix rising from the ash,  
We fight through the fire, we find our stash.  
Don't give up, there's hope, just hold tight,  
In the darkest hour, we'll find the light.

(Chorus)
Pandemic hit hard, minds in a bind,  
Isolation's shadow, peace hard to find.  
But like seeds breaking through concrete ground,  
Our resilience grows, profound and unbound.

(Verse 2 - ABABCC)
We’re warriors in a battle, hearts made of steel,  
Facing demons in our minds, they won't steal our zeal.  
Life throws punches, but we roll with the grace,  
In the ring of life, we find our own pace.  
The world might shake but we stand tall,  
We’re unbroken, we rise through it all.

(Bridge)
Masked faces, yet our eyes still shine,  
In this global struggle, we'll redefine.  
Mental health's a challenge, but together we stand,  
Building bridges of support, hand in hand.

(Outro)
So listen to the beat, let it guide you through,  
In this rap of life, we find what's true.  
Don't give up, there's hope in every line,  
In unity and strength, we'll be just fine.
